comm: lovely shape to move the ball away from the LHB. Hits a good length with pace and good bounce too
too full around off, he pushes it into the covers and then dives at the umpire's end to make it in time. Sharp throw but it missed and looks like he was in
well outside off on length, Dilshan sees room and goes for the big swing but misses
147kph! Right on the off stump and moves away a bit to beat Dilshan's outside edge. Some noise from the bat hitting the ground which made Wade appeal
gets bat this time - slightly wider outside off on length with the angle and Dilshan defends into the covers
a firm drives back to the bowler this time. Bit too full and straight, Dilshan shows the full face of the bat and Starc gets a hand to it
starts on the leg stump with some turn, Gunathilaka defends it back
stumping appeal from Wade as Gunathilaka is beaten by turn outside off, third umpire at work now and easy decision - not out. It was nicely bowled outside off on length and the turn did the rest
hits the good length again outside off, he plays on the up and gets the ball to point after a bounce
much fuller around the off stump, driven nicely but almost straight to cover
straighter on middle stump, worked to the leg side now for one
lunges forward towards the ball outside off and defends with soft hands for one
good pace and on length just outside off with the angle, Dilshan drives with hard hands but misses again. Starc frowns and shakes his head
swing and a miss again - a touch fuller outside off on similar length, Dilshan chases and misses again
short ball now and he pulls it away for four! Not sure why Starc banged it in short, Dilshan pounced on it and sent it to the midwicket boundary
that's what confidence can do to you - it's outside off now, enough room and Dilshan opens his arms to drive it hard and wide of point for a four along the ground
that's the yorker from Starc, right on middle stump! Dilshan goes deep in the crease and digs it out to the off side for a quick single

bowled'im, through the gate! That one pitched on length outside off, and it was the cutter from Starc, it came in after pitching and Gunathilaka's gap between bat and pad was too wide for the ball to sneak through

bowled'im around the legs, is he? They are checking with the replays and it shows the ball touched the pad before clipping the leg stump. Lyon around the wicket, pitches it around middle and leg and gets it to turn a bit, Dilshan wanted to work it away gently with the turn but inadvertently exposed his leg stump and the ball got deflected off the thigh pad and onto the stump. "See you, pal," said one of the Australians while crossing Dilshan to congratulate Lyon
nicely tossed up around off, steered to the leg side with the turn
a bit on the front foot and Chandimal defends it back
shorter and flatter around leg, loud appeal from Lyon as Chandimal went back and was hit on the pads, not out
more towards the off stump now, worked to the leg side again
almost like the ball that got Dilshan but this one goes further down leg for a wide
outside off now, on length and with some turn, Chandimal leans forward a bit and is beaten. Takes the ball on the body
quick and full outside off, pushed down the ground to mid-off
just short of good length outisde off, uses the angle to move it away from the batsman, left alone
touch wider outside off again on similar length, left for the keeper again

on the pads and clipped away through the air for four! Wasn't completely full but it was on the leg stump and Mendis flicked it away with the wrists, checking his shot in the end a bit, and it sailed wide and over midwicket
back to the outside off stump line, Mendis doesn't move his feet much but defends on the off side
much shorter and outside off, Mendis goes on his toes on the back foot and tries to beat point but a dive saves a few runs for Australia
on leg stump, Chandimal goes across a long way to expose his leg stump but middles the sweep veyr well to dispatch it for four behind square
quicker and outside off, he goes back to block it
comes down the ground now and drives it on the on side
waits for the ball to turn towards him and works it to leg for one
bit of extra bounce with the turn, he goes back and defends it to leg
presses forward towards the pitch of the ball outside off and blocks it back, not letting it turn
141kph, bangs in the bouncer that Chandimal ducks under just in time. The crowd likes it and makes some noise
beautifully bowled outside off, hardly any room but the ball moves away just a touch, not allowing Chandimal to connect as he tried to poke without footwork

a confident appeal for caught behind form Australia, they think Chandimal has edged it but the umpire says no. It was pretty full outside off, Chandimal drove away from the body and replays show that was a good decision - ball missed the bat and the sound was of bat hitting the ground
much closer to the batsman now, still outisde off, he defends it to the leg side off the back foot
another bouncer - just towards the leg side but not enough for a wide. It was quick and short, Chandimal ducked again and Starc is enjoying that. He sticks his tongue out while staring at Chandimal

full delivery to end the over, nicely driven with a forward lean through the covers and they get two. Starc collected the ball and then threw it to the keeper but hit Chandimal instead. The batsman didn't like and the umpire had a word with Starc
a wide to start the over down the leg side
little shorter towards leg and it's swatted for one
too fine down the leg side just past the batsman and the keeper, the turn helped the batsman as he looked to nudge it fine and he gets four leg byes
better delivery outisde off, he defends it back
closer to the batsman around off with some turn, worked to leg with the turn
comes down the track to reach the pitch of the ball and tonks it over the wide long-on boundary for a clean six! Good, confident strike
flatter one on the off stump, Chandimal goes back and defends on the leg side
short of a length angling across the right-hander, Mendis gets on tippy toe and cuts, the fielder at point dives to his right to cut off the shot
short of a length and at the body, Mendis stands tall, relatively speaking, and defends towards the bowler
nudged off the hips on the leg side
good length on middle and off stump, Chandimal plays the ball with soft hands towards point and calls Mendis through
cut in the air but behind the man at point, there's protection at third man
pushed back to the bowler, Faulkner scampers to his left to field in his follow through and pretend-throws, the batsman hurries back into his crease
Mendis greets him with a slog down on one knee, not sure he intended it to go between the bowler and mid-on but he made enough contact to score a boundary

shot! Steps out of his crease to a ball pitching outside off and spinning into the right hander, and drives so fluently, right off the middle of the bat and mid off has no chance, all along the ground too
tries to pull a flatter ball but makes no contact, that was down leg side
lovely shot! Steps out again and hits so cleanly through the line, lofting it straight back over the bowler's head
flatter and quicker ball from over the wicket, Mendis pulls but doesn't beat the infield

short ball and it's been pulled for the fourth boundary in the over! Head gave Mendis a long hop and the batsman went back so quickly and placed the ball in front of the fielder on the square leg boundary
Zampa prevents the fifth boundary in the over. Mendis had stepped out and lofted over mid off again, Zampa gave chase and pulled the ball back in just before he tumbled over the rope
short of a length pitching outside leg and angling into the hips, turned behind square for a single
good length on middle and off stump, Chandimal stays in his crease and pushes towards point
short of a length and much slower, the batsman tries to glance towards square leg but is beaten by the change of pace
a fuller and straight ball, driven back to the bowler, Faulkner fields in his follow through
full length on the pads, flicked through midwicket and the half-century stand comes up off 49 balls
good length around off, the line angles across the right-hander from over the wicket, Chandimall presses forward and plays the ball into the covers
dropped short close to off stump, not much turn, Mendis is back in a flash and his cut beats the diving fielder at point to his right. Head makes a great diving save on the boundary
bowled fuller and slower through the air, Mendis leans forward and defends
tossed up outside off stump, his length draws Mendis forward while defending on the off side
bowled flatter and quicker on off and middle stump, Chandimal plays the back-foot punch into the covers
tossed up much fuller around off, driven hard into the ground and towards long off
punched off the front foot towards long off again, Mendis had to reach a bit in front of his body to play that shot
short of a length outside leg stump, not advisable with fine leg in the circle, Mendis swivels and swats and collects a boundary towards fine leg
played from the crease towards cover point
driven along the ground to long on for another single
defended from the crease towards point
pitches around off and pings away from the right-hander, Chandimal reaches for it with a tentative prod, trying to guide to third man, but he makes no contact
pushed through cover point for a single to ensure six runs come off the over
tossed up on off stump, driven off the front foot to long off for a single
nice flight on off stump, the length brings the batsman forward again, reaching out for the ball to push into the covers
that is extremely wide outside off stump
good length and the line is just outside off, Mendis defends watchfully towards point
a fuller ball outside off, driven to long off for a single
bowled nearly into the blockhole, dug out on the off side
cut off the back foot through cover point
defended on the off side
played watchfully on the off side again
bowled flat and angling into the right-hander, pushed to long on for a single
defended back towards the bowler
slightly shorter outside off stump, cut off the back foot but can't beat Smith at cover point
played back to the bowler off the front foot, just the one run off that over, reckon Finch might get another
pitches on a good length outside off and the ball skids through quick, did not turn, Chandimal tried to cut off the back foot but was beaten on the bottom edge
gets down on one knee, right across his stumps, and paddles the ball from middle stump towards fine leg
defended on the front foot on the off side
presses forward and outside off and punches on the up towards long off
pushed back to the bowler
shot! All wrists on display in that flick, he came out of his crease and whipped the legbreak along the ground towards deep midwicket
gets down on one knee and sweeps the ball from just outside off through square leg. I think SL will be more positive against Finch this over
driven gently along the ground to pick up a single to long on

bowled full and straight, driven towards extra cover and there's a HUGE mix up between the batsmen, both of them are nearly at the striker's end. However Finch doesn't not get back to the bowler's end - he went for the ball instead - so Smith decides to go for a direct hit, and he misses. Neither batsman was in the frame, he had so much time. Australia have bungled this, and Sri Lanka are so lucky
played into the off side for a single
pushed to long on for a single
steps out and drives to long off to make it six singles in the over
premeditates his paddle sweep a bit and gets hit on the pad, the ball goes towards short third man for a leg bye
swept to deep backward square leg for a single
driven firmly towards wicket where Warner dives to cut off any runs, excellent work on the full length dive
defended quite watchfully
strays down leg side, the batsman misses the glance
defended on the front foot towards the off side
tries to drive but fails to time the shot well on the off side, time for a drinks break
good length just outside off stump, Mendis gets on the front foot and punches into the covers
short ball, way too short at that pace - 123kph - Mendis moves across and pulls behind square, he does not bother with keeping it down because there's no fielder there
pushed into the off side on the front foot
short of a length outside off, Mendis presses forward and then goes back to slap-cut the ball through cover point
so good from Chandimal, leans forward to a full ball outside off and drives to split the gap between extra cover and mid off
good length outside off, Chandimal stays back and defends on the off side
taken low on the full and drives the ball on the front foot to long on
leans forward and across and nudges the ball across his front pad towards midwicket
defended on the front foot towards point

Mendis raises consecutive fifties with a nudge towards square leg off the pads, he acknowledges the applause from his captain, team-mates and the crowd. He's revived this innings after SL lost two wickets in two balls
worked on the leg side for a single

what's happened there? The ball angled across him from around the wicket, pitched outside off stump and then spun back in to cramp the right-hander for room. Mendis tried to cut on the back foot but got a bottom edge that bounced off Wade's pad, I think
that close call has not put Mendis off, he presses forward to a length ball and lofts through the line, hitting the ball dead straight and beating Starc on the boundary
good length outside off, dabbed from the crease to point
good length on off and middle, nudged from the crease towards midwicket for a single
a fuller ball on middle and leg, played off the pads into the leg side
good length on off and middle, no room to work with there, driven off the front foot to the bowler
stays back and opens the face late to steer the ball to third man
steps out and drills the ball straight and hard, times it so well that the fielder at long off has no chance, the 100 partnership is up

played towards third man and they take on the fielder - Starc - in the deep and come back for the third run! There's a direct hit but Mendis is not worried when they go up to the third umpire. He's safe by a long way
gets down low on the front foot to sweep the full toss, great timing but he's placed it to the fielder at deep midwicket
an appeal for lbw but that's not out, missing leg, Chandimal came forward and tried to play on the leg side but missed and was hit on the pad, it turned a fair bit
nudged off the pads for a single to square leg
that is a rocket of a sweep shot, great contact, he got so low and brought his bat down with such speed, great timing and placement and the ball races to the square leg boundary
nudged off the pads on the front foot through square leg and they race back for the second because the fielder from the deep has to run in quite a bit
defended on the leg side

pitches on off and spins away from the right hander, the length is short enough to allow the batsman to go back and play against the turn on the leg side, the ball trickles through midwicket and there's no fielder in the circle, they sprint back for the second again
cut off the back foot through cover point
tossed up on off stump, met on the front foot with a straight bat, Mendis drives to long off
played into the covers, dot ball to finish
short of a length and straight, gets behind the line and defends to the bowler
a fuller length on leg and middle, Mendis pushes forward and plays the ball towards midwicket
Bailey dives to his right at cover to cut off Mendis' firm front-foot push
moves forward and slightly across and plays a chippy flick in the air, clears the infield but falls well short of the fielder in the deep
short of a length slanting across the right-hander, Mendis moves back and opens the face to push the ball through point
short of a length outside off, cut in the air through where a gully might have been

Wade fails to collect the ball and misses the stumping! Chandimal came down the track to work the ball to leg against the turn but missed it completely! Wade missed it too after the ball clipped the top of the back pad and he now insists on using the review for lbw. Smith calls for the review. Replays show the ball is close to the inside edge of the bat as Chandimal tried to flick on the half-volley, but there's no HotSpot. Third umpire now checking for the rest - it's pitched on leg, it's going straight and it's hitting the stumps. Decision overturned and Wade pumps his fist!
edged first ball outside off, it was flat and quick and Mathews cut it hard which induced a thick outside edge fine on off. Three runs to get off the mark
pretty short and turning away from outside off, he slaps it straight to cover
lovely bowling! Nicely flighted outisde off, Mendis wants to drive it away after waiting for it but hea's beaten in the air
bit closer to the batsman, who turns it to midwicket
much fuller outside off, Mendis drives it along the ground with the turn to long-off
pretty full outside off with the angle, driven nicely with a forward lean but straight to mid-off
bangs it in short now outside off, Mendis goes on his toes and fends the ball to gully where there's a misfield from Smith for one
pretty quick and wide outside off, slanting away with the angle. Not called a wide, maybe just inside the line
138kph, back of length on the pads now, Mathews works it off the thigh pad for one towards square leg
pretty straight now to Mendis, he presents a straight bat to push it down to mid-on
tries the yorker but it's a low full toss on off, a tentaive Mendis pushes it back to mid-off
bit of flight on off stump, Mathews lunges forward to block
lot of flight this time, almost a full toss and Mathews pushes it back with soft hands
full again around off, driven down easily to long-off for one
tries to turn it away from off stump, Mendis works it down to long-off before that
low full toss on the leg stump now, driven down to long-on

loud appeal for lbw with the googly, he's got the big wicket of Kusal Mendis! Nicely tossed up on off stump, Mendis played for the legspin with the front pad in front of the stumps and bat outside the line, but the ball turns in enough to hit him right in front of the stumps. Easy decision, that one and a big breakthrough!
fullish and well outside off, Mathews drives into the covers with no footwork
length delivery now outside off, Mathews helps it to third man by opening the face of the bat late
short ball, just enough room for de Silva to stand back and tall and slap it away past backward point for a cracking four! What a way to get off the mark against Starc
Test match special - shoulders arms for the length delivery angling away from him
too full on the pads, he flicks it away late enough to send it behind square and fine leg comes into play to cut it before it goes for four

nasty short ball from Starc - 146kmh. He banged it in around middle stump and it went straight towards de Dilva's head. Hard to leave that quick a ball. He takes it on the glove to keep it down and Starc gives him a stare. The crowd replies on de Silva's behalf
appeal from Wade as Mathews is struck outside leg by a flighted delivery
fuller on the pads, flicked straight to midwicket
nice inside-out drive for the full delivery on off, sends it down to long-off
Googly? De silva keeps hit bat close to pad and defends it back from off stump
driven firmly into the covers and Smith stops it with one hand in the covers
flighted again around off, driven back and Zampa gets a hand to it
starts off with a length delivery and it's worked to leg for one
on middle and leg, he stays in the crease and helps it to midwicket for one
beats him outside off with the angle. Nicely bowled on length, Mathews hardly moved his feet and poked and missed
more towards the off stump now, pushed into the covers
bit wider and fuller outside off, driven down to long-off for one
back of lenght with hardly any room, de Silva shuffles across a bit and defends it late on off
nicely flighted outside off, bit too full and it's driven down to long-off

that's number three for Zampa, good low catch from Smith at cover! Flighted as usual outside off, de Silva opened up and drove hard with a big swing, looking to go through the covers, but handed it straight to the captain
turning into the LHB from middle, he helps it to short fine leg
the flatter one outside off, beats Kusal's out side edge as he looks to defend
comes down the track now to take it on the full and drives it down to mid-off
too short, Kusal goes back and opens up to pull but doesn't middle it well
pretty flat on middle, worked to leg with the turn
comes down and Lyon pitches it shorter, Mathews still helps it to leg
waits for it to turn towards him and helps it late just behind square for one
length delivery on off, Kusal unleashes a reverse-sweep and beats the fielders for four! Well executed, drilled in the gap and fearless way to get off the mark
shorter outside off, Kusal goes back and steers it to deep point
presses forward outside off and defends with soft hands towards point for a quick single
slightly flat on off and turning away, Mathews punches it back to Zampa
nicely flighted on leg, turning towards middle and Mathews blocks it back
not as much turn from outside off, Mathews cuts it straight to point
flighted and full on the leg stump, turned to midwicket
on middle again, Mathews waits and then pushes it back in the air, but wide of Zampa, towards long-off

mid-off is in, Kusal goes out and beats the fielder with a hard-hitting stroke down the ground. He came down the track to take the ball on the full, not allowing it to turn, and hammered it back between the bowler and mid-off
works the ball with the turn from middle to the leg side for one
comes down to drive but gets a thick inside edge to midwicket
too much on leg and Kusal sweeps it away to fine leg for one
flick of the wrists to send the ball down to long-on with the turn
on length just outside off, Kusal defends with a forward lean
touch shorter which makes Kusal go back to let it turn and he cuts it square for one
bit of shuffle down the track and he steers it to long-on with the turn
shortish on leg, Mathews waits for it to come to him and jabs it to leg for one
the agrressive Kusal dances down and strikes it to long-on after a bounce
lot of flight for that full toss, driven down to long-on again
dangerous reverse sweep as that pitched on middle, he's still sent it away to third man for two
turns in sharply towards Kusal from off stump, he's cramped for room but gets his bat down in time for a single to leg
room for Kusal as the ball turns away, cuts it nicely to the deep
bit full on the stumps, Mathews pushes it back and Lyon dives to his right to stop that
powerful drive this time from Mathews and it's gone straight back to hit the non-striker's stumps, making Kusal dive back into the crease. Bowler was not even close
driven with the turn down to long on
comes down the track and offers a defence for the length delivery
fuller and quicker outside off, driven firmly through the covers and Mathews wants two but Kusal says now
right on the middle stump, worked straight to midwicket
more towards leg now, deflects off the pad and then off the diving keeper's gloves for a leg bye
slightly full outside off, Mathews presents the full face for a single down the ground
on the leg stump again, Kusal tries to work it behind square but gets another leg bye
too wide outside off, driven without any footwork to deep cover
no room, Kusal drives that length ball with firm hands to midwicket
helps the ball with the turn to short fine leg
more flight and Mathews works it with soft hands towards midwicket for a quick single
it's not full enough to be reverse swept, Kusal tries but the bounce beats him
even shorter now, Kusal goes back and cuts it away for one. Mathews said no this time
work of the wrists to work the ball to deep midwicket in the gap and Kusal dives to complete the second run. Excellent running
stays in the crease now and helps it to leg for one
short ball, Mathews goes on his toes and defends it to square leg for one
some outrageous stuff from Kusal - this one is well outside off but he goes down on a knee and whips it behind square on leg for one
just outside off and it's pushed down easily for one
outside off and he pushes it into the covers
on midlde and angling towards leg, whipped with hard hands to the long leg region and they have enough time for the second
defends this one without moving much into the covers
dances down, takes it on the full and heaves that with the turn over the wide long-on boundary for a six! He doesn't just rotate the strike
length ball outside off, he defends it back
too full on middle, he stays back and works it square on leg for one
comes down and sees Lyon drop it short a bit, Kusal takes it on the pad
full on the leg side, Kusal connects with a powerful sweep and Head slides to his right to just keep it in with his right hand

another clean strike - up and over to the same region and Mathews is turning it on here! What a strike this was - came down and absolutely hammered that with the turn to wide long-on. He's a powerful man
Kusal now - that's not too full but Kusal has flicked that away to the square boundary on the leg side in the gap for four
almost in the block hole on leg, Kusal waits and digs it out
from the back of the hand towards the block hole, Kusal looks for the slog but gets it towards fine leg with an edge
bit too wide outside off, pushed down to long-off for one
back of the hand slower ball, Kusal heaves it over midwicket for one more
on length outside off, pushed down to long-off for one
back of length outside off, Mathews defends off the back foot
short ball now and he pulls it away in the gap in deep midwicket and Kusal comes back in time for two
outside off on length, helps it just wide of point for a single

top edge goes high and higher and Zampa has dropped it at short third man! He's had a great day but will be disappointed with this. Kusal gave the charge and swung his bat, got a top edge that got the elevation but no distance. Zampa hardly had to move but it just popped out of his hands
bit of charge again and pulls the short ball to deep square leg for one

another edge from Kusal - this one lands just wide of Smith who was running towards his right from midwicket. On middle and leg from Starc and Kusal turned the face of the bat but got the timing wrong. Bit of leading edge fell safe
big swing of the bat for the length delivery outside off, misses it completely
139kph, bowls on the leg side now and Kusal swings again but it's gone down for a wide
Starc gets it right this time, Kusal makes room and Starc sends down a block hole outside off, Kusal chases and misses

almost in the block hole on middle, he wants to hit the stumps, but Kusal makes room and makes so much of it that he has hammered it over the covers right from the middle of the bat for a cracking four!
tries another yorker, it's a full toss on leg and Kusal flicks it to midwicket for one
full toss outside off, pushed gently into the covers for one and Mathews keeps strike
slightly slower outside off, pushed towards the off side for one
Kusal makes room, Henriques pitches it short and the batsman goes hard at it, gets a thick edge and Wade dives to his left to save four!
Kusal goes low and Henriques bangs in the bouncer, Kusal lets it go

he has absolutely clobbered that - gives the charge against the short ball that was outside off and pulled it with such brute power that no fielder can move, forget stop it. Four to the midwicket boundary
stays in the crease and works it behind square on leg for one
in the block hole out side off, Mathews sticks his bat out to steer the ball to deep point and that's his half-century. What a crucial innings it has been, and he's not done yet

Starc eyes the toes, Kusal makes room and his bat swing generates such power that even when he doesn't middle it, the ball goes to some planet at least. The powerful flick sent the ball to the leg side, nobody knows where but it went pretty high
on the off side now, driven firmy through the covers and it's Kusal fifty now, he gets a tap on his head from the captain
pretty wide full toss outside off, Mathews reaches out only with his bat, not feet and takes one
Kusal makes room as usual and this time Starc bangs it in short outside off. There's good bounce too and Kusal doesn't connect
chases him with a yorker and inside edge off the bat goes to fine leg
charges down and swats the ball down to long-on for two
slower one from back of the hand, Kusal tries to reverse swat it over short third man and misses. But it's called a wide
comes down, doesn't get room but the edge sends the ball to long-on and Mathews calls for two but there's not enough time
such a clean hit  from Mathews! He gave the charge, took it on the full and struck the ball back right through the line, straight over the umpire's head for four!
nudges it wide of point for one to give Kusal the strike

loud appeal for lbw from Faulkner - both arms in the air like Akram - and the finger goes up! It was the slower one and absolutely full, hitting Kusal's boot as he tried for another reverse swat, but missed it, taking it in front of middle leg stump
outside off, Mathews nudges it to leg delicate hands and gets one

that's some shot to unleash on the first ball! Not a great delivery either - short and angling away, allowing Thisara to open his arms and he did it well to send the ball flying over the covers and wide of long-off
short ball, pulled away, Smith jumps at the boundary but it sails over him!
it has disturbed the bowler's line - this one is too wide outside off
on length on the off stump, the bat comes down hard and it's dispatched towards long-on. Mathews has been there for a while but he comes back in time for the second
a bouncer this time and he lets it go
mixes it up nicely with a slower ball that beats Thisara, it goes just over the stump, but oh dear! Wade misfields, it goes right through him and for four byes!

Faulkner strikes again, Mathews hits this one absolutely straight but long-off catches it just inside the boundary. It was full and straight, Mathews hit through the line but it lacked that extra distance and Henriques ran to his right to catch that safely

that's a hat-trick from Faulkner, he's knocked over the stumps now! Thisara made some room, Faulkner targetted the stumps and beat the batsman who tried to cut but the bat came down too late. And Faulkner, who does it so often in the slog overs, is pulling things back here. Don't forget his performane in the first ODI!
beats his bat by bringing this ball in just a bit, Dilruwan looking to defend it on off but takes it on the body
too wide outside off, Dilruwan chases that with a horizontal bat and does well to guide tht into the gap, just wide of backward point, and gets four for that
slow length delivery outside off, Dilruwan spots it and drives through cover for one
outside off again and it's driven away through the covers for two
he's hit the off stump, Starc, you beauty! He bowled that one from wide of the crease with the angle, targetted the off stump with some pace and Dilruwan showed his bat on the wrong line
148kph! From wide of the crease, Aponso makes a lot of room, but it's too quick and he can't get any bat on that. It wasn't too far from the stumps
too full outside off, looking for the yorker, Aponso steers it away, wide of point and gets two in the gap
outside off, not using that angle that much, big swing and a miss from Aponso
Starc takes his third, he's hit the stumps again and SL are bowled out! From wide of the crease again, right in the block hole and through the batsman to hit the middle and leg stumps!
back of length outside off, Warner punches it in the covers
on the off stump now, Warner pushes it to short cover now
driven firmly into the covers again, short cover gets his left hand to it, deflects to mid-off and the batsmen take a single
seam movement brings the ball into Finch and beats him, he takes it high on the pads
some room on the off side now, punched to cover point
towards the pads again and Finch works it away towards deep midwicket for two

he's got Warner first ball! Nice and tempting line just outside off, Warner drives, the ball moves away just a bit and the edge is taken easily by Chandimal! Thisara is pumped and charges towards his team-mates to celebrate. What a big wicket tht is
shuffles across as usual, Smith, and works the ball from outside off to midwicket for two
some room from back of length and Smith punches that nicely off the back foot between cover point and backward point for two
seams it in a bit from outside off, Smith drives it down to mid-off
too full on Smith's pads, you can't bowl to him there! Shuffled just a bit and flicked those wrists away to guide the ball away from midwicket for a four
thisk edge goes wide of slip and third man cuts it in. There was some room, Smith square drove off the back foot and got a thick outside edge which was chased by third man
just back of length towards off stump, pushed down to mid-on
bit more angle on this one towards middle and leg, helped away past midwicket for one
back to outside off stump line, no room and Smith defends it back
hardly any movement from Smith, stays in the crease and defends the lenght ball back
bit too full now, driven handsomely to point
shuffles across too much, whips and misses and takes ball on hip or thigh pad as it goes to point
subtle change of pace - 104kph - and Finch picks it, then works it to deep midwicket for one
some room outside off, Smith drives away from the body and gets an edge to third man

make it two for this Perera, he's got both openers out of the way! This one was not on hittable length outisde off, Finch went ahead with his slog for the leg side but only managed an inside edge onto the middle stump!
hops back for the back of length ball and gets the ball to third man with a very thick edge, off the mark first ball
short of length again outside off, seams it in and Smith tries to cut but gets an inner edge
too full now around off and Smith gets it down to mid-on for a quick single
gets room this time outside off, it's short too and Smith throws his hands at it, chopping it behind backward point to beat third man too, for four
goes deep in the crease and defends it late on the off side
length delivery coming in towards the stumps, helped to square leg
bit too full outside off, he lets it go for the keeper
nice and sharp bowling on the off stump, Bailey is hurried onto the back foot to defend
targets the off stump again, Bailey defends it back off the back foot again
this one wasn't that short, Smith still made it look like one. Went on the back foot and pulled that one behind square in the gap
inside edge for four! This back of length ball seamed in after pitching, Smith punched and got an inside edge to the leg side for four
fuller this time from Thisara, comes in again and Smith pushes it back
change of pace again, squares up Smith with a puff of dust from the pitch! It held its line after pitching around off and took the outside edge
this one comes in towards the stumps, Smith keeps his bat close to the pads and gets bat-pad just in time
looks to flick this one away to leg but its beaten and gets an inside edge onto his pad. Thisara changing his pace and movement very well here
short of length around off, Bailey hops on the back foot to defend it back
straightens off the pitch from outside off, surprises Bailey a bit and takes the outside edge to third man
towards the off stump, no room at all and Smith defends solidly
keeps his bat close to pad and blocks the length delivery back
118kph, keeps lower than Smith's expectations as he looks to pull that away, swings and misses, taking the ball on the thigh pad for a leg bye
some room on the off side, Bailey drives but finds one fielder in the packed off side field
offers some room, Smith reaches out with a forward lean and drives that away through the covers in the gap for four
back of length now outside off, makes Smith go back and he defends off the inner edge
much fuller just outside off, not enough room and Smith pushes it back
waits for the ball outside off and defends it towards cover point
short and wide outside off, but Smith reaches out for it and pulls to the leg side. Doesn't middle it and finds midwicket. He expresses his disappointment
outside off with lesser room now and Smith can't put it away. Excellent comeback after a boundary on the first ball
angling in towards middle and leg, helped to square leg for one
goes back and across, helps the ball behind square but can't beat short fine leg and has to settle for one
slightly full outside off, driven down nicely but to mid-off
he gets a short and wide ball, Bailey punches it square and Prasanna throws in a superb dive to his left, parallel to the ground, and gets a hand to save two
not as much room now, Bailey goes back and defends it on off
falls just short of cover! It was pitched up, Bailey drove on the up and a bit in the air, and it fell just short of the fielder
some flight outside off, Smith defends with a forward lean

is it the pressure that's got Smith, he's handed a catch to mid-on! Came down the track, took the ball almost on half-volley but failed to clear mid-on where Dilruwan took a couple of steps back to pouch it easily just over his head
moves around a bit in the crease before defending the ball back
takes out the sweep on his second ball to find short fine leg
on the stumps now and Wade presses forward to defend
pretty full on the middle stump, swept to deep backward square for one
pretty tight outside off, defended off the back foot
sweeps it with the turn behind square for two
flighted well outside off, pushed gently to short cover
full toss and Wade cashes in by driving that firmly through the covers in the gap for four! Will ease some pressure, that one
turns it down the leg side for a wide

loud, loud apeal for lbw as Wade is struck full on the front pad, the umpire says no and Chandimal asks for a review just in time. It was flighted by Prasanna, Wade looked to sweep and missed it and now replays show it pitched outside off and even struck him outside off, so not out it is
bit too much on the leg side and it's swept successfully this time for one
turning into the batsman and he works it with the turn to leg for one
driven inside out, not from the middle, and it's stopped by a diving cover fielder
tries to drive it away again and gets an inside edge back to the bowler
right on the off stump now, straight bat display from Bailey
another dot ball as Bailey pushes the ball on off and Aponso dives to his left to stop it, gets the crowd's cheer too
bit outside off, Bailey waits for it to turn and it turns a long way away from him, then he helps it to point
pretty full on the pads, worked away with the turn to leg for one
turns it away from Bailey who pushes it back and in the air but in no man's land towards long-off. He's smiling, as usual
low full toss on middle, can't put it away and finds midwicket
dipping full toss again, maybe expecting Wade to sweep and miss, and he plays across the line for an inside edge just behind square for one
Bailey pushes down the ground now, but gets an inside edge to leg
goes deep in the crease and nudges the ball towards midwicket for one
lunges forward and blocks the ball from off stump
too much down the leg side and swept easily past short fine leg for one
loud appeal mainly from the bowler as Bailey sweeps and takes it on the front pad, but it was going down leg
towards the stumps, no room, Bailey slaps it back with some force and Aponso gets his hands to his right, ramming into Wade
nicely flighted on leg stump, flicked gently to midwicket. Five dot balls in that over
bit of flight and Wade flicks it with the turn to leg for two
some turn down the leg side, it goes for a wide and past the keeper two. So three runs in all
some flight just outside off, Wade reaches out way out of his crease and sweeps for two
comes down the track, Prasanna bowls it slower and Wade nudges it to midwicket
another sweep now, takes it as a full toss with a big stride and gets one more
and Biley sweeps too, more like a paddle and against the turn to guide the ball behind square for one
sharp turn from outside off, gets an inside edge too and hits pad, not far from the stumps
counters the second ball with a reverse sweep and gets two
tries the finer sweep now, first slip started running towards leg slip early but it lobbed just over him and out of his reach
flat on the off stump, pushed back and Dilruwan dives to his right, can't hold on to it, but no run
shorter outside off, Wade goes back and chops it ito backward point
gently drives the fuller delivery from outside off to cover
comes down the track, the ball turning into him and he works it away to deep midwicket
Wade looking to sweep, gets into position early and Dilshan bowls it really slow, beating him outside off
makes room this time and cuts this one off the back foot for one
shorter delivery, it turns a fair bit, Bailey pulls and gets a top edge over backward square for one
punches the ball off the back foot to sweeper cover for one more
reverse sweeps this one from around leg for one more single to end the over
loud appeal from Dilruwan and the men around Bailey, no says the umpire! He was sweeping the ball, and most probably the ball hit his front pad just outside the off-stump line
sweeps and connects this time, for one behind square
down the leg side, goes past Wade as he looks to nudge and no signal from the umpire which means it's given as runs and Kusal runs a long way to his left and then slides to save a couple of runs
takes a couple of steps down to help the ball to long-on
beats him nicely with some flight, turn and bounce outside off, just past the outside edge
towards the pads now and Wade nudges it to midwicket for one
Wade lunges on the front foot and then falls over as he loses balance, think he over-reached, the ball goes off the inside edge behind square
pushed on the off side from the crease
goes back and punches the ball to cover
angled into the left-hander from around the wicket and Wade turns it off the pads behind square
that's too short and Bailey goes back, squares up, and pulls. The ball races along the turf but Dilruwan Perera slides and and does well on the square leg boundary
defended on the off side, only three runs off that over
good length outside off stump, some turn away from Wade who pushes forward and plays to cover
shorter length with width outside off, Wade cuts off the back foot and cuts crisply, he can't beat backward point though
Wade moves back and towards leg to punch on the off side but was cramped for room by one that skidded on with the arm instead of turning away
pitches outside leg and turns down leg side, Perera moves quickly to collect. How on earth has that not been called wide? Bizarre
played on the leg side for a single
pushed off the front foot into the covers where Dilshan prevents the single
Bailey presses forward, gets down low and unfurls the reverse swat, hitting the ball to deep cover
steps out of his crease but isn't in a position to play an attacking shot, he defends on the leg side
goes right back and hits the ball along the ground to long on
nudged from the crease on the leg side
gets down on one knee and sweeps the ball behind square for a single
pitches around off stump and spins away, Wade moves back and dabs the ball in front of point
strides forward to defend and bat and pad are close together, the Sri Lankans appeal because they think it hit pad first, umpire says not out, impact might have been just outside the line too
tries to sweep this time but fails to make proper contact
pushed off the front foot into the covers for a single
bowled wide down leg side, Bailey gets across and tries to sweep but misses, that has been called wide
shorter and flatter ball, Bailey goes back and pulls along the ground to deep square leg
leans forward and drives a fuller ball through midwicket
driven off the front foot through point for a single to finish the over
lunges forward and across to close the face and tuck a delivery angling across him from around the wicket towards square leg
tossed up outside off, Bailey drives along the ground to long off for a single
connects with the sweep well enough to beat short fine leg to his right but not well enough to beat long leg to his left
defended on the front foot

bowled him! Bailey's struggle is over for the night. Aponso slowed it up by giving the ball a lot of air, drawing Bailey forward into the cover drive. more of a slap really because he was not to the pitch of the ball. The ball then dipped on the right-hander, falling under his bat and skidded straight on with the arm, instead of spinning away, to hit off stump
big turn on that one, pitching on a good length just outside off and spinning away from the tentative back-foot defence from Henriques
defended on the front foot into the off side
good length angling into the left-hander, pushed off the front foot back towards the bowler
punched off the back foot towards point
waits deep in his crease and cuts late, can't place it past point though, Perera's line is tight
the length is a bit short and Wade's cut flies off the thick outside edge past the first slip to the third man boundary

ripping turn and bounce, a flighted ball angles into the left-hander from around the wicket, pitches outside off and then screams away off the pitch. Wade began to push forward and then reared out of the way, the ball beat the keeper - he just got glove on it - and first slip had a small chase to make
swept towards deep backward square leg for a single

huge appeal for caught behind down the leg side but the umpire says not out, Wade's sweep was uncontrolled and he took one hand off the handle as he played the shot, the ball spun and bounced and just seemed to miss the glove
this time he connects with the sweep and places the ball behind square
pitches outside off and turns away, Henriques pushes forward to defend and misses the ball

lbw! The good old sucker punch that was. But Henriques has asked for a review. The previous ball pitched in a similar area and turned away to beat the bat, this one pitched aroud off and slid on with the arm into the right-hander. Henriques pushed forward to defend, but hang on, replays indicate an inside edge on to the pad. A thick one that too. So Henriques will get that overturned. Good call
defended on the front foot on the off side
stays back and plays the good length ball from off stump on the off side
defended back to the bowler
gets down low on one knee and sweeps the ball from outside off through square leg
steps forward and lifts the ball over the infield at midwicket, he's off the mark
defended on the front foot on the leg side
Wade moves forward and gets down to sweep again, one hand comes off the bat as he sends the ball towards long leg
steps forward and slightly across to tuck the ball off the pads through square leg
pushed on the off side with no real force
punched off the back foot through point for a single
nudged off the front foot to extra cover
darted flat and quickly into the pads, Henriques moves across to hit it behind square but misses and is hit on the pad
big turn after pitching around off stump away from the right-hander, Henriques plays it awkwardly on the off side

another huge and unanimous appeal from the bowler and the close fielders, did Henriques hit that? He went right back and brought his bat across his front pad and hit on the leg side, he missed and was struck plumb in front. Not sure there was an inside edge, but that was so so close
another appeal for lbw but that is missing leg stump, that was the wrong one
defended on the leg side

he's been stumped now! Prasanna drew Henriques forward with a flighted legbreak, the ball dipped and pitched in front of his lunge on the front foot and spun past the outside edge, the keeper took the bails off before Henriques could get his foot back in
defended back to the bowler on the front foot
punched off the front foot towards mid off
a premeditated paddle sweep, Perera shortened his length as a result, and Wade had to wait to make contact and place it behind square
drifts into the left-hander, and spins away sharply past the outside edge of Head's forward defence
punched off the back foot through point
Wade sweeps again and this time gets a top edge that lobs safely over the keeper and leg slip
slightly short outside the off stump, Head goes back and cuts the ball through point
played towards long off for a single
driven on the front foot towards long on
plays the sweep to hit the ball behind square, lots of huffing and puffing for little reward
edged and the ball falls short of the first slip, Head played inside the line while defending
shot! Head gets on the front foot to take the ball on the full and drills the drive wide of mid off for a rare boundary
goes back in his crease to a delivery that spins into him and nudges it towards midwicket
big turn, but down leg side, the keeper gets glove on it and prevents extra runs
nudged off the pads through square leg for a single
gets on the front foot and defends one that angles into him from around the wicket
hit on the pad by one that skids into him with the arm, that would have missed leg. Replays indicate it would have clipped leg, no reviews left though
drawn forward by a slower and flighted delivery and then beaten in the air, the ball spins sharply past the outside edge
slightly shorter this time and Head slaps it off the back foot through point
Wade brings up his ninth half-century in ODIs with a reverse sweep, he's hard to work extremely hard for it, tough tough conditions
pushes forward to defend but gets beaten by the offbreak that spins past the outside edge
tries to cut off the back foot but bottom edges it into the pitch
driven on the front foot through covers for two more
pushed off the front foot towards extra cover
steps out to take the ball on the full and hits it past the bowler for a single
slowed it up so much outside off stump, making Head wait and wait, and then spinning it past his tentative prod from the crease, that was 77kph
an inside edge takes the ball behind square leg for a single
Dilshan skids the ball into the left-hander from around the wicket, going on with the arm, hurrying the batsman into a defence
defended on the back foot, this one goes on with the arm again
steps out and lofts the ball over the fielder at mid-on, got to the pitch of the ball and hit it with some muscle
pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
top delivery, after some faster ones he slows it up, giving the batsman a lot of time to think about what the ball will do. It spins away from his front foot prod and he is beaten
pushed towards mid off on the back foot
steps out but isn't to the pitch of the ball, he adjusts well and punches the ball through the covers and into the gap in the deep
played off the front foot into the covers for another single
tries to sweep but misses, he got his front pad way outside the line of off stump though, and the ball goes off it towards third man

the ball goes close on the off side in front of the wicket after Wade plays an ill-executed sweep, the batsmen run a quick single, Chandimal sprints to the ball, picks up, turns around and fires the ball at the striker's end. It hits Head on the shoulder quite hard, but he barely winces. Chandimal apologises
defended on the off side
played off the front foot behind point
Wade goes right back and cuts the ball hard, Dilruwan dives at point and takes pace off the shot
punched off the back foot from just outside off in front of point
steps out and drives the ball along the ground to long off
a full toss angling into the left-hander from around the wicket, swatted through the leg side for a single
steps out and then lunges forward to defend awkwardly because he isn't to the pitch of the ball
dabbed on the front foot towards point
goes back into his crease and cuts the ball hard but to the man at point
plays the reverse sweep and gets a top edge that lobs safely between the keeper and short fine leg
defended on the front foot towards the bowler
bowled flat and quick into the left-hander, pushed off the front foot into the covers
driven to long off for a single
slog-swept in the air but the ball drops well short of the fielder at deep midwicket
cut off the back foot and a fumble at backward point allows the single
bowled on a good length on a wicket to wicket line, defended on the back foot
steps out but is beaten in the flight, adjusts and pushes the ball towards backward point but has to scamper back after his partner says no to the single
pushed into the covers but no single on offer, Dilshan cuts it off
cut off the back foot in front of point this time for a single
steps out to hit down the ground but mis-times it back towards the bowler, nearly yorked himself
a firm strike for the fullish delivery down the ground to long-off
Wade makes room to smash it away but de Silva bowls it slow and he finds cover
that's very well played by Wade over the covers! He came down the track, de Silva pitches it short and then Wade lofted it over the covers after the turn since there's nobody in the deep
makes it a low full toss by coming down and drives it down to long-off
nudges the length ball towards cover point and they take a quick single
gives it the charge again with a big heave and he gets an inside edge towards square leg for one
this one slides in towards the stumps, Wade makes room and cuts to short third man
uses his feet to come down and lofts that with the turn over the covers and that's landed just inside the boundary for four
works it away to leg but can't clear midwicket
comes down a bit and flicks the ball against the turn to midwicket
the extra bounce beats him! Some turn for the length delivery outside off, he wants to cut but misses
much straighter towards the stumps and it's nudged to leg for one
pretty slow length delivery around off, Head waits and then punches it back for a single
pretty slow outside leg, Wade almost loses his balance while trying to work it to leg and ends up getting a single to off
104kmh, pretty short and Head pulls it away towards wide long-on for two
well outside off at 106kmh, slices it to backward point where a fumble concedes a single
low full toss on the legs as Wade comes out of his crease and whips it past the square leg umpire and a wide throw helps them come back for the second

it's that man again - Thisara Perera - and he's got Wade off a full toss! He came down the track again, ended up sweeping a low full toss high on the leg side and Gunathilaka took one of the easiest catches at deep midwicket
just back of length from outside leg, Head waits and works it away to leg for two

that's the other settled batsman to fall within three balls, Head top-edges one and Dilshan takes it! It was well outside off, hardly any pace, and Head opened up to pull it away to leg but ended up edging it high on the off side where Dilshan ran in from point
angled in towards the leg stump, Faulner helps it along to fine leg for one

slow offcutter at 108 and second wicket for Mathews in the over with that return catch! Pitched it up and rolled his fingers a bit over that one, Starc merely pushed it back in the air and Mathews took it comfortably around waist height
right on target towards the stumps, good length, and Zampa defends it back
128kph, angling in a bit towards the off stump, Zampa defends with a straight bat again
angling in from around the wicket towards the stumps, blocked back
some turn for Aponso as Faulkner defends again, gets the outside edge and it goes just wide of first slip. Excellent running to come back for three
he goes for the drive and leaves a big gap between bat and pad which the ball sneaks through, just outside off
connects the drive this time and finds cover
more towards middle and off now, blocked back off the front foot
that's a beauty - slower through the air just outside off, making him drive and when he does, the ball turns away with some bounce to beat the outside edge
flighted and full on the stumps, nice loop and drift and Faulkner defends it back
nicely flighted again, pretty full too, and he just defends it back
pretty full again and he drives it down to long-off this time
sharp turn from leg stump, he punches it into the covers after the turn
much fuller now and it's driven firmly through the covers for one
keeps really low as Zampa stays back to cut but the lack of bounce beat him just outside off
full on middle now, he drives and gets an edge back to the bowler
errs down the leg side but luckily for him, it deflects off the pad
tosses it up on the off stump, Zampa drives it off the edge back to the bowler again
a bit more towards middle and leg, Zampa swings it to leg for one
tossed up outside off, pushed back to the bowler
flighted and full, swings against the turn towards deep midwicket for one
drives a bit late and a thick edge rolls away towards backward point
some turn away from Faulkner, keeps low too and beats the outside edge
more towards the stumps now and Faulkner blocks it back
juicy full toss towards leg and that was an easy swat from Faulkner to place it towards square on the leg side for four
down the leg side now, it's gone very fine past the keeper and they run three. No signal from the umpire which means three off the bat
slowish and straight towards the stumps, blocked back
bit wider outside off and Faulkner pushes it back
the turn beats Faulkner as he kept his bat in front of off, where the ball pitched, but it turned away just a bit to go towards the keeper's right
worked towards leg now against the turn for one

swept away to the leg side and he's found deep midwicket, third wicket for Aponso! It was pitched up, and Zampa went down on a knee to sweep it away nicely but it didn't go all the way and Dilshan had to run to his right to make it nine down
proper forward-lean defence from Faulkner for the length delivery outside off
optimistic appeal as Lyon sweeps and is hit well outside the off stump
sweeps against the turn again and the turn beats everything this time
third attempted sweep and misses it again
fourth sweep in a row and he connects this time, two towards deep midwicket
sweep again and gets an under edge to make the ball go through the keeper's legs for two
six balls, six sweeps and it ends the way it started - fails to connect
tossed up towards middle, Faulkner blocks it back

flighted again, this time Faulkner is hit on the pad in front of leg stump, SL appeal and the finger has gone up. But Faulkner reviews it. Replays show no inside edge and ball-tracking shows it was 'hitting' the stumps. Australia all out for 206
